Status Epilepticus.scope: Management of convulsive and non-convulsive status epilepticus in adults

Core Labs.rationale: Electrolyte abnormalities, renal/hepatic function for ASM dosing
Elevated in prolonged seizure; marker of severity

Essential.rationale: Seizure burden, treatment response, NCSE detection

Extended.item: MRI brain with and without contrast

Extended.rationale: If stroke suspected - large vessel occlusion

Stabilization.dosing: Head-tilt chin-lift, oral airway, prepare for intubation
50 mL IV push (25g) if glucose <70 or unknown
100-500 mg IV BEFORE or WITH glucose

First-Line (Benzodiazepines).dosing: 4 mg IV push over 2 min; may repeat x1 in 5 min; max 8 mg total
10 mg IM single dose (if no IV access)

Second-Line ASMs.rationale: Preferred - fewest drug interactions, no cardiac monitoring

Second-Line ASMs.dosing: 20 mg PE/kg IV at 150 mg PE/min

Second-Line ASMs.rationale: Alternative - check ECG for PR interval

Refractory SE (Anesthetics).dosing: Load 0.2 mg/kg bolus; then 0.1 mg/kg/hr, titrate to burst suppression; max 2 mg/kg/hr

Refractory SE (Anesthetics).rationale: Consider EARLY - more effective when given early

Refractory SE (Anesthetics).dosing: Load 1-2 mg/kg; then 20-200 mcg/kg/min; limit <48h at high dose
Refractory SE (Anesthetics).rationale: Alternative - monitor for propofol infusion syndrome

New Onset Seizure.scope: Initial evaluation and management of first-time unprovoked seizure

Core Labs.rationale: Elevated if drawn within 10-20 min; helps distinguish from PNES

Extended Workup.rationale: Thyroid dysfunction can affect seizure threshold

Essential.rationale: Tumor, mesial temporal sclerosis, cortical dysplasia

Maintenance ASMs.dosing: 500 mg PO BID; titrate to 1000-1500 mg BID
Maintenance ASMs.rationale: First-line for most patients; broad spectrum

Maintenance ASMs.dosing: 25 mg PO daily x2 weeks, then titrate slowly; target 200-400 mg/day
50 mg PO BID; titrate to 100-200 mg BID

Safety.rationale: No driving until cleared (state laws vary: 3-12 months)
Avoid heights, swimming alone, operating machinery
Take ASM consistently; do not stop abruptly

MS - New Diagnosis.scope: Initial diagnostic workup and management of suspected or newly confirmed MS

Extended Workup.rationale: Low levels associated with MS risk/activity
Combined NMO/MOGAD screen; cell-based assay is gold standard

Essential.item: MRI brain with and without contrast (MS protocol)
Essential.rationale: Periventricular, juxtacortical, infratentorial lesions; gadolinium enhancement = active

Essential.item: MRI C-spine with and without contrast
MRI T-spine with and without contrast

Extended.rationale: Prolonged P100 latency (subclinical optic nerve involvement)

Symptomatic - Spasticity.dosing: Start 5 mg TID; increase by 5 mg/dose every 3 days; max 80 mg/day
Symptomatic - Spasticity.rationale: First-line for spasticity; do NOT stop abruptly

Symptomatic - Spasticity.dosing: Start 2 mg qHS or TID; max 36 mg/day

Symptomatic - Neuropathic Pain.dosing: Start 300 mg qHS; target 900-1800 mg TID; max 3600 mg/day
Start 75 mg BID; max 300 mg BID
Start 30 mg daily × 1 week; increase to 60 mg; max 120 mg/day

Symptomatic - Fatigue.dosing: 100 mg every morning; may add 100 mg early afternoon; max 200 mg/day
Start 100 mg every morning; max 400 mg/day

Symptomatic - Walking.dosing: 10 mg q12h exactly 12 hours apart; max 20 mg/day
Symptomatic - Walking.rationale: For walking impairment; avoid if seizure history

Consults.rationale: All new MS diagnoses for DMT discussion
Optic neuritis, visual symptoms, OCT baseline
Gait dysfunction, lower extremity weakness, falls

Safety & Education.item: Return precautions: rapid vision loss, sudden weakness, difficulty breathing, urinary retention
Safety & Education.rationale: Know when to seek emergency care

Safety & Education.item: Avoid driving until cleared by neurology
Heat may temporarily worsen symptoms (Uhthoff phenomenon)
Safety & Education.rationale: This is not a new attack

Safety & Education.item: Expect temporary steroid side effects: insomnia, mood changes, increased appetite
Do not stop baclofen or tizanidine abruptly

Lifestyle.rationale: Smoking accelerates MS progression and disability
Hot tubs, saunas, prolonged direct sun

Peripheral Neuropathy.scope: Initial diagnostic workup and symptomatic management of suspected or newly diagnosed peripheral neuropathy

Extended Workup.rationale: Detects IGT missed by FBG/HbA1c; high yield in idiopathic neuropathy
Deficiency OR toxicity (>200 mg/day) causes neuropathy

Specialized.rationale: If motor-predominant or acute onset (GBS variants)
Subacute sensory neuronopathy, weight loss, smoking

Essential.rationale: Pattern determines axonal vs demyelinating, distribution, severity

Extended.rationale: If radiculopathy, myelopathy, or polyradiculopathy suspected

Acute/Emergent.dosing: 500 mg IV TID × 3 days, then 250 mg IV daily × 3-5 days
1000 mcg IM daily × 7 days, then weekly × 4 weeks, then monthly

Neuropathic Pain - First-Line.rationale: First-line SNRI, especially for diabetic neuropathy

Apply TID-QID; takes 2-4 weeks for effect
Applied by healthcare provider for 30-60 minutes; repeat every 3 months

Start 0.1 mg daily; max 0.3 mg daily
Start 100 mg TID; max 600 mg TID

1 mg/kg/day (max 80 mg) × 4-6 weeks; taper over 3-6 months

Refractory neuropathic pain, spinal cord stimulator evaluation

Safety & Foot Care.item: Return precautions: sudden severe weakness, difficulty breathing, rapid progression
Safety & Foot Care.rationale: Know when to seek emergency care

Safety & Foot Care.item: Inspect feet daily for cuts, blisters, or wounds
Wear well-fitting, protective footwear at all times
Test bath water temperature before entering
Safety & Foot Care.rationale: Avoid burns due to impaired sensation

Safety & Foot Care.item: Use night lights and handrails to prevent falls

Lifestyle.rationale: Alcoholic neuropathy is reversible if early
Improves circulation, glycemic control, reduces pain
